abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Mangoro Forestry Project in
            Madagascar was implemented .The frequency of the Bank's
            supervision missions and the mission member profiles met the
            project's requirements. However, there were rather
            frequent changes in the personnel assigned to supervision,
            which did not always have a favorable impact on either the
            consistency of approach regarding the line of conduct to be
            followed, or the promptness in decision making and
            implementation. On numerous occasions since 1983, missions
            have referred to the Mangoro plantations in discussions both
            with forestry experts at the Bank and other various four
            authorities in Madagascar. Relations between project
            personnel and the latter seem to have been excellent. While
            certain differences of view may have existed on specific
            technical points, the harmonious execution of the project
            has never suffered. During project implementation, certain
            requests to purchase supplementary equipment and machinery
            were refused, although the allocation was far from
            exhausted. These actions partially handicapped project
            implementation. Because of the interim nature of this
            project, the list of materials and equipment to be procured
            could not be fully identified at the start of the project,
            hence, procurement delays. The same goes for the quantity
            and the nature of the inputs.

display_title.display_title:
Madagascar - Second Mangoro
            Forestry Project : Credit 1161 - Credit Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Mangoro Forestry Project
            components are: (a) establishment of about 18,000 ha of pine
            and 500 ha of eucalyptus plantations, their maintenance and
            protection; (b) maintenance and protection of the existing
            plantations (about 70,000 ha); and the maintenance of roads,
            buildings and infrastructure in the Project area; (c) the
            construction and maintenance of roads and buildings; (d)
            pasture improvement; (e) research and training; and (f)
            studies for industrial development planning, and preparation
            of projects in the forestry and agricultural sector.
